name: pulsar-ide-typescript
description: A Pulsar-native IDE provider package for TypeScript and JavaScript

nodeBin.title: Path to Node
nodeBin.description: Usually the default will detect the correct version of Node for your path. Specify this value if you encounter errors. Check the README for more information.

includeJavaScript.title: Include JavaScript
includeJavaScript.description: Whether to use this language server's features for JavaScript files. This package will attempt to set sensible defaults for JavaScript projects, but you can customize the experience further with a [`jsconfig.json` file](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/jsconfig) at your project root.

enable.title: Enable
enable.description: Whether to show diagnostic messages via the `linter` package. (To change this setting for a specific kind of file, use a scoped setting.)

ignoredCodes.title: Ignored Codes
ignoredCodes.description: A comma-separated list of diagnostic codes that should be ignored by the linter.

ignoredCodesWhenBufferIsModified.title: Ignored Codes (while buffer is modified)
ignoredCodesWhenBufferIsModified.description: A comma-separated list of diagnostic codes that should be ignored by the linter **until you save the buffer**. (This can suppress linter messages that interrupt you to remind you to do things that you were about to do anyway.)

includeMessageCodeInMessageBody.title: Include Message Code in Message Body
includeMessageCodeInMessageBody.description: When enabled, will include the code for a linter message at the end of its body.

enable.title: Enable
enable.description: Whether to provide symbols for the current file, for project-wide symbol search, and for going to the definition of a symbol. (To change this setting for a specific kind of file, use a scoped setting.)

enableForFileSymbols.title: Enable For File Symbols
enableForFileSymbols.description: Whether to act as a provider for file symbols. Has no effect unless **Enable** is also checked.

enableForProjectSymbols.title: Enable For Project Symbols
enableForProjectSymbols.description: Whether to act as a provider for project symbols. Affects the `symbols-view` commands **Toggle Project Symbols** and **Go To Declaration**. Has no effect unless **Enable** is also checked.

ignoredTags.title: Ignored Tags
ignoredTags.description: A comma-separated list of tags that should be ignored when generating symbols.

minimumQueryLength.title: Minimum Query Length
minimumQueryLength.description: The minimum number of characters a user must type on a **project-wide symbol search** before the request is forwarded to the language server.

implicitProjectConfiguration.title: Implicit Project Configuration
implicitProjectConfiguration.description: Governs IDE package behavior on projects that **do not** have a `tsconfig.json` or `jsconfig.json` file. These settings are ignored if either file is present in the project.

checkJs.title: Check JavaScript
checkJs.description: Enable/disable semantic checking of JavaScript files.

experimentalDecorators.title: Enable Experimental Decorators
experimentalDecorators.description: Enable/disable `experimentalDecorators` in JavaScript files that are not part of a project.

strictFunctionTypes.title: Strict Function Types
strictFunctionTypes.description: Enable/disable [strict function types](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig#strictFunctionTypes) in JavaScript and TypeScript files that are not part of a project.

strictNullChecks.title: Strict Null Checks
strictNullChecks.description: Enable/disable [strict null checks](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig#strictNullChecks) in JavaScript and TypeScript files that are not part of a project.

target.title: Target
target.description: Set [target JavaScript language version](https://www.typescriptlang.org/tsconfig#target) for emitted JavaScript and include library declarations.

enable.title: Enable
enable.description: Whether to suggest contextual completions with `autocomplete-plus`. (Takes effect after a window reload or a restart of Pulsar.)

enable.title: Enable
enable.description:
Whether to enable automatic code formatting. When disabled, this package will not act as a code formatting provider under any circumstances. When enabled, you must still have a package such as `atom-ide-code-format` to implement code formatting and to control whether it is applied on save, while you type, or only when you ask for it.

**Before enabling**, please ensure that this behavior will not interfere with any other format-on-save behavior might be active in your project from integrations with (e.g.) ESLint or Prettier.

(Takes effect after a window reload or a restart of Pulsar.)

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: The priority of this code formatting provider. Consumer packages use priority to decide which provider should “win” if several are available for a given task.

formattingRules.title: Formatting Rules
formattingRules.description:
This section controls the specific style rules that will be applied when code formatting is invoked over a range or an entire file.

These settings correspond to identical settings in the [typescript-language-server configuration](https://github.com/typescript-language-server/typescript-language-server/blob/0a034dae6c777733f4c2f6d5b151c5ef781fb662/docs/configuration.md#workspacedidchangeconfiguration).

If any of these style settings should differ between TypeScript and JavaScript, you may specify scope-specific overrides in your `config.cson`.

semicolons.title: Semicolons
semicolons.description: Whether to enforce presence of absence of semicolons.

insertSpaceAfterSemicolonInForStatements.title: Insert space after semicolon in “for” statements
insertSpaceAfterSemicolonInForStatements.description: Enabled: `for (let i = 0; i < x.length; i++)` Disabled: `for (let i = 0;i < x.length;i++)`

insertSpaceBeforeAndAfterBinaryOperators.title: Insert space before and after binary operators

insertSpaceAfterKeywordsInControlFlowSta.title: Insert space after keywords in control flow statements

insertSpaceAfterFunctionKeywordForAnonym.title: Insert space after “function” keyword for anonymous functions

insertSpaceAfterOpeningAndBeforeClosingN.title: Insert space after opening and before closing non-empty parentheses
Insert space after opening and before closing non-empty braces
Insert space after opening and before closing non-empty brackets

insertSpaceAfterOpeningAndBeforeClosingE.title: Insert space after opening and before closing empty braces

insertSpaceAfterOpeningAndBeforeClosingJ.title: Insert space after opening and before closing JSX expression braces

insertSpaceAfterOpeningAndBeforeClosingT.title: Insert space after opening and before closing template string braces

insertSpaceAfterTypeAssertion.title: Insert space after type assertion
insertSpaceAfterTypeAssertion.description: Enabled: `: asserts x is Foo` Disabled: `:asserts X is foo`

insertSpaceBeforeTypeAnnotation.title: Insert space before type annotation
insertSpaceBeforeTypeAnnotation.description: Enabled: `type Foo : unknown` Disabled: `type Foo: unknown`

placeOpenBraceOnNewLineForControlBlocks.title: Place open brace on new line for control blocks

placeOpenBraceOnNewLineForFunctions.title: Place open brace on new line for functions

enable.title: Enable
enable.description: Whether to act as a hover information provider via the `datatip` and `hover` services. Hover information offers useful context for tokens under the cursor or mouse pointer. (Takes effect after a window reload or a restart of Pulsar.)

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: The priority of this hover information provider. Consumer packages use priority to decide which provider should “win” if several are available for a given task.

enable.title: Enable
enable.description: Whether to act as a signature help provider via the `signature-help` and `signature` services. Signature help offers guidance about each parameter as you type the arguments of a function. (Takes effect after a window reload or a restart of Pulsar.)

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: The priority of this signature help provider. Consumer packages use priority to decide which provider should “win” if several are available for a given task.

additionalScopes.title: Additional Scopes
additionalScopes.description: A comma-separated list of additional language scopes for which the language server's features should be used. (The language server will not start automatically when you open one of these files; you may have to start the language server manually via the **Pulsar Ide Typescript Alpha: Start Language Server** command.)

symbol.provider.description: Allows external sources to suggest symbols for a given file or project.
